thread.title: Pics: Mega livery for Bright’s new start
thread.title_full: Pics: Mega livery for Bright’s new start

title: Pics: Mega livery for Bright’s new start
text:
Supercars: Jason Bright reveals livery, enduro co-driver for 2017 season February 15, 2017 11:58am by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS JASON Bright has revealed his Supercars livery for 2017, his first back with Prodrive in over a decade. 
The Supercars veteran will be backed by MEGA Fuels, a brand new sponsor to the sport. 
The company’s purple, blue, white and black hues adorn Bright’s No. 56 Ford Falcon FG X, unveiled at Prodrive’s Melbourne headquarters on Wednesday. 
Prodrive also took the opportunity to reveal Bright’s co-driver for the Enduro Cup, with Dunlop Super2 Series champion Garry Jacobsen pairing with the veteran for Sandown, Bathurst and the Gold Coast. 
“The car looks fantastic,” said Bright. “The front of the car looks quite aggressive and should stand out on the track. The colours of the MEGA Fuels logo makes for a great race livery.” Jason Bright’s No. 56 Mega Bulk Fuels Ford. Source: Supplied 
Bright arrives at Prodrive after a seven year tenure at Brad Jones Racing, getting a quick chance to sample one of their Fords at Winton late last year. 
“The car didn’t do anything surprising but it was quite different to what I’m used to,” Bright said. 
“Having said that I was comfortable in the car quite quickly and that will only improve when it is set up to my specifications. Bright and Garry Jacobson. Source: Supplied 
“How the car behaves will obviously be different again when we go to Sydney Motorsport Park for the test day as well, particularly with the introduction of the new tyre construction so it’ll be a lot to acclimatise to on one day but I’m confident that I’ll be ready to take on Clipsal by the end of it.” 
The new colours will hit the track for the first time at the Supercars tyre test at Sydney Motorsport Park on Tuesday next week. Jason Bright’s No. 56 Mega Bulk Fuels Ford. Source: Supplied View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
